tit.cmt: タイトルには（）で補足を入れることになっていますが、複数の語義が後述されるため入れておりません。

sen.j: 水切り（みずきり）
sen.e: Mizukiri
Mizukiri
Mizukiri

sen.j: 水面に向かって回転をかけた石を投げて、水面で石を跳ねさせる遊び。
sen.e: Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water.
Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water.
Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water.

sen.j: 本項にて詳述する。
sen.e: Mizukiri in this sense will be discussed in detail later.
Mizukiri in this sense will be discussed in detail in this section later.
sen.cmt: 脱落しているin this section追加しました。
sen.e: Mizukiri in this sense will be discussed in detail in this section later.

sen.j: 最も代表的な、水揚げの方法。
sen.e: Mizukiri is the most typical way of water raising.
Mizukiri is the most typical way of water raising.
Mizukiri is the most typical way of water raising.

sen.j: 生け花や生花を扱う業種で、切花が長持ちするようにする処理方法の一つ。
sen.e: It is one of the methods used in Japanese flower arrangement and the businesses dealing with real flowers for keeping cut flowers fresh.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is one of the methods used in Japanese flower arrangement and the businesses dealing with real flowers for keeping cut flowers fresh.
It is one of the methods used in Japanese flower arrangement and the businesses dealing with real flowers for keeping cut flowers fresh.

sen.j: 植物の茎や根を水に浸し、水中でこれを切ること。
sen.e: It is practiced by soaking stems or roots of plants and cutting them in the water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is practiced by soaking the stems or roots of plants and cutting them in the water.
It is practiced by soaking the stems or roots of plants and cutting them in the water.

sen.j: 農産物の収穫前に灌水を行なわないこと。
sen.e: Mizukiri is not to spray water before harvesting farm products.
Mizukiri is not to spray water before harvesting farm products.
Mizukiri is not to spray water before harvesting farm products.

sen.j: 糖度が高くなる。
sen.e: This gives a high sugar content.
This gives a high sugar content.
This gives a high sugar content.

sen.j: メロンなどの果実の栽培で行なわれる。
sen.e: It is practiced to grow fruits such as melons and so on.
It is practiced to grow fruits such as melons.
sen.cmt: and so on削除しました。
sen.e: It is practiced to grow fruits such as melons.

sen.j: 食材や物に付いた滴や水分を落とす事。
sen.e: Mizukiri is to drain off water drops and the water from foodstuffs or objects.
Mizukiri is to drain off water drops and moisture from foodstuffs or objects.
Mizukiri is to drain off water drops and moisture from foodstuffs or objects.

sen.j: また、その時使用するボウル（調理器具）の一種→ コランダー
sen.e: It also means a kind of bowl (a cooking utensil) which is used on this occasion: colander.
It also means a kind of bowl (a cooking utensil) which is used on this occasion: colander.
It also means a kind of bowl (a cooking utensil) which is used on this occasion: colander.

sen.j: 雨水が建物や土台の隙間などに入り込まないように用いられる工法の一種。
sen.e: Mizukiri is one of the construction methods which is used to prevent rainwater from leaking into cracks of a building or a foundation.
Mizukiri is one of the construction methods which is used to prevent rainwater from leaking into cracks of a building or a foundation.
Mizukiri is one of the construction methods which is used to prevent rainwater from leaking into cracks of a building or a foundation.

sen.j: 貨物船から積荷を陸に揚げる荷役のこと。
sen.e: Mizukiri is cargo work in which cargo are unloaded from a freight vessel.
Mizukiri is cargo work in which cargo are unloaded from a freight vessel.
Mizukiri is cargo work in which cargo are unloaded from a freight vessel.

sen.j: 水切り（みずきり）は水面に向かって回転をかけた石を投げて水面で石を跳ねさせて、その回数を競ったりする遊びの事。
sen.e: Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water, sometimes competing to see how many times the stone skips.
Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water, sometimes competing how many times the stone skips.
Mizukiri is a game of throwing a stone with spin toward the water surface to make it skip over the water, sometimes competing how many times the stone skips.

sen.j: 「水の石切り」、「石切り」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called 'Mizu no ishikiri' or 'Ishikiri.'
It is also called 'Mizu no ishikiri' or 'Ishikiri.'
It is also called 'Mizu no ishikiri' or 'Ishikiri.'

sen.j: 世界中、ある程度の大きさを持つ水面と石のある場所であれば、どこででも見られる遊びである。
sen.e: This is the kind of game which can be seen anywhere in the world, as long as the water surface above a certain size and stones are present.
This is the kind of game which can be seen anywhere in the world, as long as the water surface above a certain size and stones are available.
This is the kind of game which can be seen anywhere in the world, as long as the water surface above a certain size and stones are available.

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国での呼称はStone skipping。
sen.e: The game is called "Stone skipping" in the United States.
The game is called "Stone skipping" in the United States.
The game is called "Stone skipping" in the United States.

sen.j: 日本における跳ねた回数の単位は「段」。
sen.e: The unit of a number of skipping in Japan is 'dan.'
The unit of the number of skipping in Japan is 'dan.'
sen.cmt: 定冠詞に変更しました。
sen.e: The unit of the number of skipping in Japan is 'dan.'

sen.j: 概説
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 水切りは簡単に誰にでも出来る遊びとして各地で行われており、水切りのイベントが行われることもある。
sen.e: As a game easy for everyone, mizukiri is played everywhere and mizukiri events are also held.
As a game easy for everyone, mizukiri is played everywhere and mizukiri events are also held.
As a game easy for everyone, mizukiri is played everywhere and mizukiri events are also held.

sen.j: また、熊谷市などでは市民の同好会的組織も存在している。
sen.e: There are the citizens' club-like organizations in Kumagaya City and so on.
There are the citizens' club-like organizations in Kumagaya City and so on.
There are the citizens' club-like organizations in Kumagaya City and so on.

sen.j: 水切りを行う際は、投げる前方に遊泳中の人がいないかなど、周りの人にけががないように注意するとともに、水鳥などの野生動物への配慮も忘れてはならない。
sen.e: To play mizukiri, it is necessary to make sure that there is no one swimming in a forward direction in order not to hurt people nearby, and also to be considerate of wild animals such as waterfowls and so on.
To play mizukiri, it is necessary to make sure that there is no one swimming in a forward direction in order not to hurt people nearby, and also to be considerate of wild animals such as waterfowls.
sen.cmt: and so on削除しました。
sen.e: To play mizukiri, it is necessary to make sure that there is no one swimming in a forward direction in order not to hurt people nearby, and also to be considerate of wild animals such as waterfowls.

sen.j: 世界
sen.e: World
World
World

sen.j: 2008年現在のギネス・ワールド・レコーズは、2007年7月19日にRussell Byarsが記録した51段である。
sen.e: As of 2008, listed in Guinness World Records is 51 skips set by Russell Byars on July 19, 2007.
As of 2008, listed in Guinness World Records is 51 skips made by Russell Byars on July 19, 2007.
As of 2008, listed in Guinness World Records is 51 skips made by Russell Byars on July 19, 2007.

sen.j: それ以前の記録は、2002年9月14日にカート・スタイナー（Kurt Steiner）が "Pennsylvania Qualifying Stone Skipping Tournament" で記録した40段であった。
sen.e: Until then, the record was 40 skips set by Kurt Steiner at "Pennsylvania Qualifying Stone Skipping Tournament" on September 14, 2002.
Until then, the record was 40 skips made by Kurt Steiner at "Pennsylvania Qualifying Stone Skipping Tournament" on September 14, 2002.
Until then, the record was 40 skips made by Kurt Steiner at "Pennsylvania Qualifying Stone Skipping Tournament" on September 14, 2002.

sen.j: 日本
sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

sen.j: 日本記録は千葉ロッテマリーンズ投手の渡辺俊介がテレビ番組「徳光&所のスポーツえらい人グランプリ」にて出した32段である。
sen.e: Japan record was set by Shunsuke Watanabe, a pitcher of the Chiba Lotte Marines, in a TV program, 'Tokumitsu Tokoro no sports eraihito Grand Prix' (Tokumitsu and Tokoro's Great-People Grand Prix of Sports), with 32 skips.
sen.cmt: 「徳光&所のスポーツえらい人グランプリ」－定訳不明
sen.e: Japan's record was set with 32 skips by Shunsuke Watanabe, a pitcher of the Chiba Lotte Marines, in a TV program, 'Tokumitsu Tokoro no sports eraihito Grand Prix' (Tokumitsu and Tokoro's Great-People Grand Prix of Sports).
sen.cmt: Japan →Japan'swith 32 skipsをsetの後に移動しました。
sen.e: Japan's record was set with 32 skips by Shunsuke Watanabe, a pitcher of the Chiba Lotte Marines, in a TV program, 'Tokumitsu Tokoro no sports eraihito Grand Prix' (Tokumitsu and Tokoro's Great-People Grand Prix of Sports).

sen.j: 「水切り」、「石切り」という呼称以外にも様々な呼び名が存在する。
sen.e: The game is called by various names other than 'Mizukiri' and 'Ishikiri.'
The game is called by various names other than 'Mizukiri' and 'Ishikiri.'
The game is called by various names other than 'Mizukiri' and 'Ishikiri.'

sen.j: 石投げ
sen.e: Ishinage (Stone-throwing)
Ishinage (Stone-throwing)
Ishinage (Stone-throwing)

sen.j: 跳ね石遊び
sen.e: Haneishi asobi (Skipping-stone's game)
Haneishi asobi (Skipping-stone game)

sen.j: 水面石飛ばし
sen.e: Suimen ishitobashi (Stone-throwing over water surface)
Suimen ishitobashi (Stone-throwing over water surface)

sen.j: 科学的考察
sen.e: Scientific investigation
Scientific investigation
Scientific investigation

sen.j: 日本放送協会テレビ「熱中時間 忙中"趣味"あり」で、超高速度カメラやコンピュータを使い、水切りを科学的に分析した結果が紹介された。
sen.e: Necchu jikan bochu "shumi" ari' (The enthusiasm time, Enjoy a hobby even if you are busy), a TV program on NHK, introduced the scientific analysis of mizukiri using an ultrahigh-speed camera and a computer.
sen.cmt: 文頭の「'」はエクセルでは表示されないため消えています。原文には「日本放送協会」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「ＮＨＫ」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。「熱中時間 忙中"趣味"あり」－定訳不明
sen.e: Necchu jikan bochu "shumi" ari' (The enthusiasm time, Enjoy a hobby even if you are busy), a TV program on NHK, introduced the scientific analysis of mizukiri using an ultrahigh-speed camera and a computer.

Necchu jikan bochu "shumi" ari' (The enthusiasm time, Enjoy a hobby even if you are busy), a TV program on NHK, introduced the scientific analysis of mizukiri using an ultrahigh-speed camera and a computer.

sen.j: それによると、よく跳ねるための水面との角度は、前面が10°浮き上がった状態が最もよいとされる。
sen.e: According to the analysis, the optimum angle for skipping between the surface of the water and the front of the floating stone is 10 degrees.
According to the analysis, the optimum angle for skipping between the surface of the water and the front of the floating stone is 10 degrees.
According to the analysis, the optimum angle for skipping stones is for the front face to be raised by 10 degrees with respect to the surface of the water.

sen.j: また、石自体が高速回転（番組中では1秒間に30回転）していることが大切で、回転が遅いと早く水没してしまう。
sen.e: It is important that the stone is rapidly spinning (at 30 revolutions per second in the program) because if it's slow it falls into the water soon.
It is important that the stone is rapidly spinning (at 30 revolutions per second in the program) because if the revolution is slow it falls into the water quickly.
It is important that the stone is rapidly spinning (at 30 revolutions per second in the program) because if the revolution is slow it falls into the water quickly.

sen.j: 石の形は、平型、かまぼこ型、レンズ型などがよいが、計算上はレンズ型が最も適している。
sen.e: Ideal shapes of the stone are flat, semicylindrical, lenticular and so on, but according to calculations, the best shape is lenticular.
Ideal shapes of the stone are flat, semicylindrical, lenticular and so on, but according to calculations, the best shape is lenticular.
Ideal shapes of the stone are flat, semicylindrical, lenticular and so on, but according to calculations, the best shape is lenticular.

sen.j: フランスの物理学者Lydéric Bocquetらや、永弘進一郎（現・宮城工業高等専門学校）らの研究によると、石が最も良く跳ねるには、石と水面との角度は20ºが最適であるとされている。
sen.e: According to the research by French physicist Lydéric Bocquet, Shinichiro NAGAHIRO (presently at Sendai National college of technology) and so on, for the best bounce of the stone, the optimum angle between the stone and the water surface is 20 degrees.
sen.cmt: 原文には「宮城工業高等専門学校」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「仙台高専」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: According to the research by French physicist Lydéric Bocquet, Shinichiro NAGAHIRO (presently at Sendai National College of Technology) and so on, for the best bounce of the stone, the optimum angle between the stone and the water surface is 20 degrees.
sen.cmt: Sendai National college of technology→固有名詞のためSendai National College of Technology
sen.e: According to the research by French physicist Lydéric Bocquet, Shinichiro NAGAHIRO (presently at Sendai National College of Technology) and so on, for the best bounce of the stone, the optimum angle between the stone and the water surface is 20 degrees.

sen.j: また、Bocquetは、Coleman-McGheeの元ギネス世界記録38回を達成するためには、秒速12メートルの速度と、毎秒14回転が必要であると算出している。
sen.e: Bocquet has calculated that it requires a speed of 12 m/s and spinning at 14 revolutions per second to reach 38 skips, the former Guinness world record set by Coleman-McGhee.
Bocquet has calculated that it requires a speed of 12 m/s and spinning at 14 revolutions per second to achieve 38 skips, the former Guinness world record set by Coleman-McGhee.
Bocquet has calculated that it requires a speed of 12 m/s and spinning at 14 revolutions per second to achieve 38 skips, the former Guinness world record set by Coleman-McGhee.

sen.j: この水切りの原理を兵器に応用したものが反跳爆弾である。
sen.e: Bouncing bomb was made by applying the theory of Mizukiri to a weapon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Bouncing bomb was made by applying the theory of Mizukiri to a weapon.
Bouncing bomb was made by applying the theory of Mizukiri to a weapon.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中にイギリスがドイツのルール地方にあるダムを破壊するために開発した『ダムバスターズ』が有名である。
sen.e: The one which was developed by the United Kingdom during World War II in order to destroy the dam in the Ruhr area of Germany is well-known by the name of "The Dambusters."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文によると『ダムバスターズ』は反跳爆弾の名前のように受け取れますのでそのように訳出しましたが、実際はダム破壊の任務にあたった部隊の通称のようです。(http://s310295659.websitehome.co.uk/dambusters/drupal/) (http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%81%E3%83%A3%E3%82%B9%E3%82%BF%E3%82%A4%E3%82%BA%E4%BD%9C%E6%88%A6)
sen.e: The one which was developed by the United Kingdom during World War II in order to destroy a dam in the Ruhr area of Germany is well-known by the name of "The Dambusters."
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞に変更しました
sen.e: The one which was developed by the United Kingdom during World War II in order to destroy a dam in the Ruhr area of Germany is well-known by the name of "The Dambusters."
